definition[0]: to give someone money, information etc when you do not really want to
example[1]: Insurance companies had to cough up £10 million in storm damage claims.
definition[1]: to push something out of your throat or lungs into your mouth
example[2]: You must go to the doctor if you’re coughing up blood.
example[3]: Grumman finally coughed up $40 million in settlement of the legal claims against it.
example[4]: We’ll get a new TV as soon as the insurance company coughs up.
